snippet: Teachers at Ashley Hall in Charleston, S.C., remained on edge, trying to grasp how Alice Boland, a woman with a public history of mental illness, managed to buy a gun a week earlier.
abstract: Teachers at Ashley Hall, all-girls preparatory school in Charleston, SC, remain on edge after botched shooting by Alice Boland one week before; many wonder how she had legally managed to buy a gun, despite her public history of mental illness.

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and ROBBIE BROWN
byline.contributor: Kim Severson reported from Charleston, and Robbie Brown from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: Teachers at Ashley Hall in Charleston, S.C., remained on edge, trying to grasp how Alice Boland, a woman with a public history of mental illness, managed to buy a gun a week earlier.

headline.seo: Suspect in Botched Shooting at Ashley Hall Bought Gun Despite Mental Illness
headline.main: Suspect in Botched Shooting Bought Gun Legally Despite Mental Illness
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Botched Shooting Bought Gun Legally Despite Mental Illness
